New Records: The Cavaliers are one win away from matching their best start in franchise history, which was 8-0 in the 1976-77 season
Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell scored 30 points including a jumper with three-tenths of a second left
Damian Lillard put Milwaukee ahead by hitting a step-back jumper with 9.8 seconds remaining
Giannis Antetokounmpo had 34 points, 16 rebounds and nine assists for the Bucks
Pre-Game Insights: The Cavaliers were missing Caris LeVert due to a sore right knee
The Bucks played without Khris Middleton, who hasnâ€™t yet made his season debut as he recovers from surgery on his ankles
Post-Match Reflections: The Cavaliers remained unbeaten with a 114-113 victory over the Milwaukee Bucks
Milwaukee has lost five straight since winning its opener
Miscellaneous Highlights: Lillard had 41 points with nine assists and shot 10 of 15 from 3-point range
The Bucks were 18 of 39 from beyond the arc, their hot start from long range helped them build a 16-point first-quarter lead
Others: The teams meet again Monday in Cleveland
